thread.title: Corners Jones, Hall sit out Wednesday Bengals practice
thread.title_full: Corners Jones, Hall sit out Wednesday Bengals practice

title: Corners Jones, Hall sit out Wednesday Bengals practice
text:
Corners Jones, Hall sit out Wednesday Bengals practice 
Updated: Wed, Oct 14 2015, 04:44 PM 
CINCINNATI (Richard Skinner) -- Bengals starting cornerback Adam Jones and nickel cornerback Leon Hall were both non-participants in Wednesday's practice as the team began on field preparations for Sunday's game in Buffalo. 
Kickoff for that game is 1 p.m. and the game can be seen on Local12. 
Jones missed due to a lingering groin injury that caused him to be listed as questionable for this past Sunday's game against Seattle and caused him to miss last Wednesday's practice, too. Jones participated in both last Thursday's and Friday's practices and then played a key role in the win over the Seahawks with two punt returns and an interception. 
Hall missed Wednesday's practice due to a back injury after coming out of the Seattle game in the second half. No official word was ever given why Hall left that game. 
Two other players also did not participate in Wednesday's practice: offensive tackle Andrew Whitworth, who was given a veteran's day off as he has at least one day a week this season and did almost every week last season, and wide receiver Brandon Tate, who was sick. 
Four other players were limited participants in Wednesday's practice: wide receiver Marvin Jones (foot); cornerback Dre Kirkpatrick (hip); offensive tackle Andre Smith (elbow) and guard Kevin Zeitler (elbow). 
Jones missed all of last season due to a broken foot and ankle problems. 
Photo: Tony Tribble for Local.12
